segments.text: Welcome back to 'Hellfire HR', the only podcast where we discuss the daily struggles of working in the underworld. I'm your host, Lucifero.
And I'm Beatrice, head of Eternal Complaints. Today's episode is a special extended edition because we have SO much to cover.
That's right! We've had a record number of complaints this week. Apparently, being damned for eternity isn't enough. People want better snacks too.
Let's start with the big one. The cafeteria is on fire again.
Again?! We just put out the last fire!
Lucifero, it's Hell. The cafeteria is ALWAYS on fire. That's not a bug, that's a feature.
Fair point. What's the complaint then?
Someone said the fire is 'not aesthetic enough.' They want it to be more... Instagram-worthy.
Instagram? We don't even have good Wi-Fi down here!
Speaking of which, IT called. The Wi-Fi password needs to change again.
What's wrong with the current one?
It's forty-seven characters. The demons keep forgetting it. We've had three mental breakdowns this week alone.
But 'TheEternalSufferingOfTheDamnedShallNeverCease666' is such a classic!
IT suggested 'password123'. They said it's 'ironic torture.'
Brilliant! That's so stupid it's actually evil. I love it!
Okay, next topic. The interns are unionizing.
WHAT?! How can they unionize? They're here for eternity!
Apparently, someone read them the 'Rights of the Damned' pamphlet.
We have a 'Rights of the Damned' pamphlet?!
Legally required. Heaven made us add it in the treaty of 1347.
Ugh, Heaven. Always ruining everything with their 'basic decency' and 'fundamental rights.'
The interns are demanding one lunch break per century.
Per CENTURY?! That's outrageous! What's next, bathroom breaks?
Actually, that's demand number two.
This is getting out of hand. Moving on! What's happening with Cerberus?
Oh, big news there! His left head has fully transitioned to veganism.
I still don't understand how a head of a hellhound goes vegan.
He watched a documentary. Something about the meat industry being 'inhumane.'
We're in HELL! Inhumane is our brand!
His middle head is now considering Buddhism.
Buddhism?! He guards the gates of Hell! You can't be Buddhist and work here!
He says he's 'finding inner peace through the chaos of eternal damnation.'
And the right head?
Still angry. Very angry. Bit three sinners this morning just for fun.
At least ONE head is still on brand. Give that head a raise!
Okay, let's talk about the new hire. Satan Junior.
Ah yes, the boss's son. How's he doing?
He showed up on his first day wearing a Hawaiian shirt and flip-flops.
No.
Yes. And he brought a ukulele.
A UKULELE?! In Hell?!
He said he wanted to 'bring positive vibes to the workplace.'
We're literally in the pit of eternal suffering! There are no positive vibes!
He played 'Somewhere Over the Rainbow' during the morning torture session. The demons were confused.
I bet! What did the sinners do?
They started crying. But like... happy crying? It was very unsettling.
This is a disaster. We need to have words with his father.
Good luck. Satan Senior is on vacation.
Vacation?! Where does the Lord of Darkness go on vacation?!
Florida.
That... actually makes sense.
Says he likes the 'authentic hellscape vibes' of the humidity.
Okay, what else is on the agenda? I need some good news.
The new torture methods testing went really well!
Finally! What did we try?
An endless Zoom meeting. No agenda. Someone always has their mic on with background noise.
Diabolical! Pure evil! Who came up with this?
Dave from Marketing. He said he 'learned from the best' during his time on Earth.
Promote Dave immediately! What else do we have?
A printer that always says 'paper jam' but there's no paper jammed.
Classic! Timeless, even.
An app that takes exactly one second longer to load than your patience allows.
Ooh, that's subtle. I like it!
And my personal favorite: a group project where everyone 'totally did their part.'
But nobody actually did anything?
Exactly! And the deadline is in five minutes. Forever.
That's beautiful. I'm actually getting emotional. These are works of art!
Speaking of art, the recreational committee has a request.
We have a recreational committee?
Yes. They want to start a company band.
What kind of band?
Death metal. Obviously.
That's actually perfect. Approved! What's the band name?
'Mandatory Fun.' Because attendance at practice is, well, mandatory.
I love the irony. What instruments do they have?
Three electric guitars, demonic drums, and... Satan Junior's ukulele.
No. No ukulele in death metal. That's where I draw the line!
He says it adds 'unexpected texture.'
The only texture I want is PAIN! Pure, undiluted PAIN!
Okay, okay, calm down. Let's move to the weather report.
We have a weather report?
Yes. Today's forecast: eternal flames with a chance of brimstone. Tomorrow: more eternal flames. Next millennium: surprisingly mild eternal flames.
Wait, mild? What happened?
Budget cuts. Apparently, brimstone is expensive.
Budget cuts in HELL?! Who's responsible for this?!
Accounting. They said we need to 'trim the fat.'
Trim the fat?! We're an eternal punishment facility, not a startup!
They also suggested we 'pivot to a more sustainable torture model.'
What does that even mean?!
Renewable suffering. Solar-powered pitchforks. Carbon-neutral hellfire.
I hate this timeline.
On the bright side, the Employee of the Century award nominations are in!
Oh! Who are the nominees?
First, there's Grimshaw from Eternal Torment. He's been here since the beginning. Very dedicated.
Solid choice. Who else?
Margaret from Accounting. She found a way to make spreadsheets 15 percent more soul-crushing.
Fifteen percent?! That's impressive even for Hell!
And finally, Dave from Marketing. He invented the Reply All email chain that never ends.
Dave is on fire lately! Figuratively and literally.
The voting starts next week. Make sure to cast your ballot in the lake of fire!
Alright folks, we're running out of time. Any final announcements?
Yes! The annual 'Bring Your Demons to Work Day' has been rescheduled.
Why? What happened?
Last year's incident. Someone's demon ate the HR handbook.
Honestly? That handbook was terrible. The demon did us a favor.
True. But we still need to rewrite it. Currently, it just says 'suffer' on every page.
Concise. Effective. I don't see the problem.
Heaven said it 'lacked nuance.'
Ugh! Heaven again! Always with the constructive feedback!
Alright, that's all the time we have for this extended episode!
Remember, if you're listening from down here, congratulations on your eternal subscription!
And if you're listening from up there... well...
We'll be seeing you eventually! Everyone ends up here sooner or later!
Until next time, keep those fires burning!
And remember: HR stands for Hellish Resources! Stay damned, everyone!
Bye!
